ai-sn19:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-sn19:1.1.3_0: while Venerable Lakkhaṇa and Venerable Mahāmoggallāna were staying on the Vulture Peak.
ai-sn19:1.1.4_0: Then Mahāmoggallāna robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to Lakkhaṇa,
ai-sn19:1.1.4_1: He went up to him and said,
ai-sn19:1.1.7_0: As Mahāmoggallāna was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain he smiled at a certain spot.
ai-sn19:1.1.10_0: “This isn’t the right time to reply.
ai-sn19:1.1.11_0: Please ask me in the presence of the Buddha.”
ai-sn19:1.2.1_0: Then, after their meal and after returning from almsround, Lakkhaṇa and Mahāmoggallāna approached the Buddha
ai-sn19:1.2.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-sn19:1.2.1_2: After the meal, on their return from alms-round, they went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. Lakkhaṇa said to Mahāmoggallāna:
ai-sn19:1.2.2_0: “Just now, as Mahāmoggallāna was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain he smiled at a certain spot.
ai-sn19:1.3.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a skeleton flying through the air.
ai-sn19:1.3.2_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks were in close pursuit of it, striking it between the ribs,
ai-sn19:1.3.7_0: and his name will get ever.
ai-sn19:1.4.1_0: The Buddha said to the mendicants,
ai-sn19:1.4.3_0: The disciples live following their knowledge: whether inheritance could perform such a disciples.
ai-sn19:1.4.4_0: Formerly, I too saw that being, but I did not speak of it.
ai-sn19:1.4.5_0: If I were to declare that sound,
ai-sn19:1.4.6_0: They wouldn’t be for their lasting harm and suffering.
ai-sn19:1.4.7_0: That being was a cattle-butcher in this very Rājagaha.
ai-sn19:1.4.8_0: As a result of that deed he burned in hell for many years, for many hundreds, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands of years. Now he experiences the residual result of that deed in such an incarnation.”
ai-sn19:1.4.9_0: (All these discourses should be expanded like this.)
ai-sn19:1.4.10_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn19:2.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a lump of flesh flying through the air.
ai-sn19:2.1.2_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing him, pecking, plucking, and hacking
ai-sn19:2.1.3_0: while it uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:2.1.4_0: “... That being, monks, was a cattle-butcher in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:3.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a morsel of flesh flying through the air.
ai-sn19:3.1.2_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing him, pecking, plucking, and hacking
ai-sn19:3.1.3_0: while it uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:3.1.4_0: “That being used to be a bird hunter right here in Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:4.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a flayed man flying through the air.
ai-sn19:4.1.2_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing him, pecking, plucking, and hacking
ai-sn19:4.1.3_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:4.1.4_0: “... That being, monks, was a sheep-butcher in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:5.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man who had body hairs of swords flying through the air.
ai-sn19:5.1.2_0: And those swords kept rising up and falling on his body
ai-sn19:5.1.3_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:5.1.4_0: “... That being, monks, was a butcher of pigs in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:6.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man with body hairs of knives flying through the air.
ai-sn19:6.1.2_0: Again and again he was stabbed by those knives,
ai-sn19:6.1.3_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:6.1.4_0: “That being used to be a deer hunter right here in Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:7.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man with body hairs of arrows flying through the air.
ai-sn19:7.1.2_0: And those arrows kept rising up and falling on his body
ai-sn19:7.1.3_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:7.1.4_0: “... That being, monks, was a torturer in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:8.1.1_0: “Just now, reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a man whose body hairs were spears flying through the air.
ai-sn19:8.1.2_0: Again and again he was pierced by those needles,
ai-sn19:8.1.3_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:8.1.4_0: “... That being, monks, was a slanderer in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:9.1.1_0: “Just now, reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a man whose body hairs were spears flying through the air.
ai-sn19:9.1.2_0: The needles bored into his head and out his mouth,
ai-sn19:9.1.3_0: entered his mouth and came out through his breast,
ai-sn19:9.1.4_0: into his chest and out his belly,
ai-sn19:9.1.5_0: into his belly and out his thighs,
ai-sn19:9.1.6_0: entered his thighs and came out through his calves,
ai-sn19:9.1.7_0: and into his calves and out his feet.
ai-sn19:9.1.8_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:9.1.9_0: “... That being, monks, was a slanderer in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:10.1.1_0: “Just now, reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a man with testicles as big as pots flying through the air.
ai-sn19:10.1.2_0: When he was walking he had to lift his testicles on to his shoulder.
ai-sn19:10.1.3_0: and when he sat down, he sat on top of his testicles.
ai-sn19:10.1.4_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing him, pecking, plucking, and hacking
ai-sn19:10.1.5_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:10.1.6_0: “... That being, monks, was a corrupt magistrate in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:10.2.3_0: And a pig-butcher and sword, a deer-hunter and knife,
ai-sn19:10.2.4_0: And with your charioteer drive your charioteer.
ai-sn19:10.2.6_0: A corrupt magistrate had testicles as burden;
ai-sn19:11.1.2_0: At one time near Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove ...
ai-sn19:11.1.3_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man sunk over his head in a cesspit ...”
ai-sn19:11.1.4_0: “... That being, monks, was an adulterer in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:11.1.5_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn19:12.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man sunk to over his head in a cesspit, eating feces with both hands ...”
ai-sn19:12.1.2_0: “... That being, monks, was a wicked brahmin in this very Rājagaha.
ai-sn19:12.1.3_0: In the time of the Buddha Kassapa’s dispensation he invited the Saṅgha of mendicants for a meal. He filled a trough with dung and said:
ai-sn19:12.1.4_0: ‘My good men, eat as much as you like, and take what’s left.’ ...”
ai-sn19:13.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a flayed woman flying through the air.
ai-sn19:13.1.2_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing him, pecking, plucking, and hacking
ai-sn19:13.1.3_0: while it uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:13.1.4_0: “... That woman, monks, was an adulteress in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:14.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a foul-smelling and ugly woman flying through the air.
ai-sn19:14.1.2_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing him, pecking, plucking, and hacking
ai-sn19:14.1.3_0: while it uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:14.1.4_0: “... That woman, monks, was a fortune-teller in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:15.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a woman flying through the air who was roasting, sweltering, and sooty.
ai-sn19:15.1.2_0: while it uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:15.1.3_0: “That woman used to be the king of Kaliṅga’s chief queen.
ai-sn19:15.1.4_0: Overcome by jealousy, she threw out her rival and poured a pan of burning coals over her. ...”
ai-sn19:16.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw the headless trunk of a body flying through the air,
ai-sn19:16.1.2_0: Its eyes and mouth were on its chest.
ai-sn19:16.1.3_0: Vultures, crows, and hawks kept chasing him, pecking, plucking, and hacking
ai-sn19:16.1.4_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:16.1.5_0: “... That being, monks, was an executioner called Hārika in this very Rājagaha. ...”
ai-sn19:17.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a monk flying through the air.
ai-sn19:17.1.2_0: His outer robe was ablaze and burning, as were his bowl, his belt, and his body.
ai-sn19:17.1.3_0: and he uttered cries of distress. ...” ...
ai-sn19:17.1.4_0: “... During the time of the Buddha Kassapa’s dispensation, that monk was a bad monk.” ...
ai-sn19:18.1.1_0: “I saw a nun flying through the air.
ai-sn19:18.1.3_0: “She used to be a bad nun ...”
ai-sn19:19.1.1_0: “I saw a trainee nun flying through the air.
ai-sn19:19.1.3_0: “She used to be a bad trainee nun ...”
ai-sn19:20.1.1_0: “I saw a novice monk flying through the air.
ai-sn19:21.1.1_0: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a novice nun flying through the air.
ai-sn19:21.1.2_0: Her outer robe was ablaze and burning, as were her bowl, her belt, and her body.
ai-sn19:21.1.7_0: and his name will get ever.
ai-sn19:21.2.1_0: The Buddha said to the mendicants,
ai-sn19:21.2.3_0: The disciples live following their knowledge: whether inheritance could perform such a disciples.
ai-sn19:21.2.4_0: I too, monks, have seen that novice nun,
ai-sn19:21.2.6_0: If I were to declare that sound,
ai-sn19:21.2.7_0: They wouldn’t be for their lasting harm and suffering.
ai-sn19:21.2.8_0: That female novice used to be a bad novice nun in the time of the Buddha Kassapa’s dispensation.
ai-sn19:21.2.9_0: As a result of that deed she burned in hell for many years, many hundreds, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands of years. Now she experiences the residual result of that deed in such an incarnation.”
ai-sn19:21.3.1_0: An adulterer submerged in a pit,
ai-sn19:21.3.2_0: An eater of feces was a wicked brahmin.
ai-sn19:21.3.4_0: An ugly woman was a fortune-teller;
ai-sn19:21.3.5_0: A sweating woman scattered coals on a co-wife,
ai-sn19:21.3.6_0: A beheaded man was an executioner.
ai-sn19:21.4.1_0: A monk, a nun, a trainee nun,
ai-sn19:21.4.2_0: A novice monk, then a novice nun;
ai-sn19:21.4.3_0: On the going forth of Kassapa
ai-sn19:21.4.4_0: they’d do bad deeds right there.
ai-sn19:21.4.5_0: The Linked Discourses with Lakkhaṇa are complete.
